etymologies: Middle English: from Old French gourde, based on Latin cucurbita

definitions: a fleshy, typically large fruit with a hard skin, some varieties of which are edible.
shortDefinitions: fleshy some varieties of which are edible

definitions: a drinking container, water container, or ornament made from the hard hollowed and dried skin of a gourd.
shortDefinitions: drinking or water container made from hollowed and dried skin of gourd

definitions: a climbing or trailing plant which bears gourds.

notes.text: Family Cucurbitaceae (the gourd family): several genera and species, including the colored ornamental gourds (Cucurbita pepo variety ovifera). The gourd family also includes the marrows, squashes, pumpkins, melons, and cucumbers

shortDefinitions: climbing or trailing plant which bears gourds
